snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced that parents of about 57,000 children were offered places at one of their top three selections for the fall.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio says about 56,000 city children have been offered spot in one of their parents' top three picks for free prekindergarten programs; over 10,000 children have been placed in schools not on their list at all, necessitating second round of applications in June in which families may apply again without sacrificing spot already assigned to them.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio announced that parents of about 57,000 children were offered places at one of their top three selections for the fall.

headline.main: Most Parents Got Top Choices for Pre-K, Mayor de Blasio Says
headline.print_headline: Most Got Top Choices for Pre-K, Mayor Says
